poem:
**The Call**

Leaders in pixels gather, heads bent,  
circling the virtual round table.  
Hope is the currency, spoken in tongues,  
a game of shadows on a luminous screen.  
  
Zelenskyy's gaze, the flame that won't quiver,  
Trump, a conductor of unfinished symphonies.  
They lean towards the hour, ancient as it feels,  
yet it's time's tether worn thin.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "European leaders set to join call with Zelenskyy and Trump on Wednesday, Germany says - as it happpened 5.01pm BST Closing summary … and on that note, it’s a wrap! US president Donald Trump said he was hoping for a “constructive” meeting to “feel out” the Russian position on Ukraine, claiming he “would know exactly” whether a deal could be made – but it wouldn’t be ultimately up to him to make it (16:44, 16:47).". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: European leaders set to join call with Zelenskyy and Trump on Wednesday, Germany says - as it happpened 5.01pm BST Closing summary … and on that note, it’s a wrap! US president Donald Trump said he was hoping for a “constructive” meeting to “feel out” the Russian position on Ukraine, claiming he “would know exactly” whether a deal could be made – but it wouldn’t be ultimately up to him to make it (16:44, 16:47).
